titleStmt.title: A true relation of the proceedings of the English army now in Scotland, from the two and twentieth day of July, to the first of August. Contained in, and extracted out of the several letters sent from the army and read in Parliament, the sixth of August, 1650. Ordered by the Parliament, that these letters, with the several extracts, be forthwith printed and published. Hen: Scobell, cleric. Parliamenti.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Army.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Edward Husband and John Field, printers to the Parliament of England,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
